summary: This is an email chain from August 6, 2020, regarding the Office of Professional Responsibility's (OPR) draft report on the handling of the Jeffrey Epstein matter by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida from 2006-2008. The correspondence involves a request for the Maxwell prosecution team to review the draft report and a subsequent authorization to share it with them.

persons.name: Laura Ingersoll
persons.context: Sent the initial email attaching the OPR draft report regarding the handling of the Jeffrey Epstein matter to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

events.title: OPR Investigation into Epstein Case Handling
events.description: The Office of Professional Responsibility conducted an investigation and produced a draft report regarding the handling of the Jeffrey Epstein matter by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida.

events.title: OPR Draft Report Distribution
events.description: OPR Counsel Laura Ingersoll sent the draft report to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, with a request for the Maxwell prosecution team to review and comment.

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida
U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, New York, New York
Office of Professional Responsibility, U.S. Department of Justice, 950 Pennsylvania Avenue, N.W., Room 3266, Washington, D.C. 20530
keyFacts: The Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) produced a draft report investigating the handling of the Jeffrey Epstein matter by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida during 2006-2008.
The draft report was sent to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York on August 6, 2020, for review by the Maxwell prosecution team.
The email chain shows internal DOJ coordination and authorization was required before the Maxwell team could be given the OPR report for review.
The document references the ongoing Ghislaine Maxwell prosecution in the Southern District of New York as of August 2020.
